Collaborative Manuscripts

HospitiumRIS provides a powerful collaborative manuscript editing system built on TipTap, enabling researchers to work together in real-time on academic documents.

Overviewâ€‹

The manuscript editor combines the functionality of professional word processors with real-time collaboration features designed specifically for academic writing.

Key Capabilitiesâ€‹

  • âœï¸ Rich text editing with academic formatting
  • ğŸ‘¥ Real-time multi-user collaboration
  • ğŸ“ Track changes with accept/reject workflow
  • ğŸ“š Version history with restore capability
  • ğŸ’¬ Inline comments and threaded discussions
  • ğŸ“– Citation management with multiple formats
  • ğŸ”„ Auto-save and conflict resolution

Creating a Manuscriptâ€‹

New Manuscriptâ€‹

  1. Navigate to Publications â†’ Collaborate
  2. Click New Manuscript
  3. Fill in manuscript details:
    • Title - Manuscript title
    • Type - Article, Review, Conference Paper, etc.
    • Field - Research field or domain
    • Description - Brief summary

Manuscript Typesâ€‹

TypeDescription
Research ArticleOriginal research findings
Review PaperLiterature review or meta-analysis
Conference PaperConference proceedings
Technical ReportTechnical documentation
Grant ProposalFunding application
Thesis/DissertationAcademic degree work

Toolbar Featuresâ€‹

ToolShortcutDescription
BoldCtrl+BBold text
ItalicCtrl+IItalic text
UnderlineCtrl+UUnderline text
StrikethroughCtrl+Shift+SStrikethrough
Heading 1Ctrl+Alt+1Main heading
Heading 2Ctrl+Alt+2Sub-heading
Heading 3Ctrl+Alt+3Section heading
LinkCtrl+KInsert hyperlink
Image-Insert image
Table-Insert table
Citation-Insert citation
Highlight-Highlight text

Text Alignmentâ€‹

  • Left align
  • Center align
  • Right align
  • Justify

Listsâ€‹

  • Bullet lists
  • Numbered lists
  • Task lists (checkboxes)

Real-Time Collaborationâ€‹

Presence Awarenessâ€‹

See who's currently editing:

  • Online collaborators shown in header
  • Colored cursors indicate editor positions
  • Names displayed at cursor locations

Conflict Resolutionâ€‹

When multiple users edit simultaneously:

  1. Changes are merged in real-time
  2. Conflicting edits are flagged
  3. Users can review and resolve conflicts
  4. History preserves all versions

Collaboration Rolesâ€‹

RoleEditCommentInviteDelete
Ownerâœ…âœ…âœ…âœ…
Adminâœ…âœ…âœ…âŒ
Editorâœ…âœ…âŒâŒ
ContributorSuggestâœ…âŒâŒ
ReviewerâŒâœ…âŒâŒ

Track Changesâ€‹

Enabling Track Changesâ€‹

  1. Click Track Changes toggle in toolbar
  2. All subsequent edits are tracked
  3. Changes appear with author attribution

Change Typesâ€‹

TypeAppearanceDescription
InsertGreen underlineNew text added
DeleteRed strikethroughText removed
FormatBlue highlightFormatting changed

Reviewing Changesâ€‹

For each tracked change:

  • Accept - Apply the change permanently
  • Reject - Discard the change
  • View Author - See who made the change
  • View Timestamp - When the change was made

Bulk Actionsâ€‹

  • Accept all changes
  • Reject all changes
  • Accept changes by author
  • Filter changes by type

Version Historyâ€‹

Automatic Versioningâ€‹

Versions are created automatically:

  • Every 50 changes
  • Before major edits
  • On manual save
  • Before session ends

Manual Versionsâ€‹

Create milestone versions:

  1. Click Save Version
  2. Add version description
  3. Version is saved with timestamp

Version Typesâ€‹

TypeDescription
AutoAutomatic periodic saves
ManualUser-created checkpoints
MilestoneSignificant project milestones

Comparing Versionsâ€‹

  1. Open version history panel
  2. Select two versions
  3. View side-by-side comparison
  4. Changes highlighted between versions

Restoring Versionsâ€‹

  1. Select the version to restore
  2. Click Restore
  3. Confirm restoration
  4. Current state becomes new version

Comments & Discussionsâ€‹

Adding Commentsâ€‹

  1. Select text to comment on
  2. Click Add Comment or use context menu
  3. Type your comment
  4. Submit

Comment Typesâ€‹

TypeUse Case
CommentGeneral feedback
SuggestionProposed changes
QuestionClarification needed

Comment Featuresâ€‹

  • Threaded Replies - Nested discussions
  • @Mentions - Notify specific collaborators
  • Resolve - Mark as addressed
  • Delete - Remove comment

Comment Workflowâ€‹

Comment Created â†’ Discussion â†’ Resolved/Deleted
       â†“              â†“
   Notify Author   Replies Added

Citation Managementâ€‹

Inserting Citationsâ€‹

  1. Place cursor at citation point
  2. Click Insert Citation
  3. Search your publication library
  4. Select publication(s)
  5. Citation inserted with reference

Citation Sourcesâ€‹

Import citations from:

  • Personal publication library
  • PubMed search
  • DOI lookup
  • BibTeX import
  • Manual entry

Citation Stylesâ€‹

Supported formats:

  • APA (7th Edition)
  • MLA
  • Chicago
  • Harvard
  • IEEE
  • Vancouver

Bibliography Generationâ€‹

  • Auto-generated from citations
  • Sorted alphabetically or by appearance
  • Formatted per style guide
  • Updates dynamically

Inviting Collaboratorsâ€‹

Invitation Methodsâ€‹

  1. ORCID Search

    • Search by name or ORCID iD
    • View researcher profile
    • Send invitation with role

  2. Email Invitation

    • Enter email address
    • System sends invitation link
    • Works for non-registered users

  3. System Users

    • Search registered users
    • Quick invitation with role selection

Invitation Processâ€‹

Send Invitation â†’ Email Notification â†’ Accept/Decline â†’ Access Granted
                        â†“
                  Expiration (7 days)

Managing Collaboratorsâ€‹

  • View all collaborators
  • Change roles
  • Remove access
  • Resend invitations

Export Optionsâ€‹

Document Formatsâ€‹

FormatDescription
HTMLWeb-ready format
PDFPrint-ready document
DOCXMicrosoft Word
LaTeXAcademic typesetting
MarkdownPlain text markup

Export Settingsâ€‹

  • Include comments
  • Include track changes
  • Include version history
  • Bibliography format

Keyboard Shortcutsâ€‹

Text Formattingâ€‹

ShortcutAction
Ctrl+BBold
Ctrl+IItalic
Ctrl+UUnderline
Ctrl+Shift+SStrikethrough
Ctrl+Shift+HHighlight

Document Actionsâ€‹

ShortcutAction
Ctrl+SSave
Ctrl+ZUndo
Ctrl+YRedo
Ctrl+ASelect all
Ctrl+FFind

Navigationâ€‹

ShortcutAction
Ctrl+HomeGo to beginning
Ctrl+EndGo to end
Ctrl+GGo to page

Best Practicesâ€‹

Collaborative Writingâ€‹

  1. Establish writing conventions early
  2. Use track changes for major revisions
  3. Comment rather than overwrite
  4. Create milestone versions regularly
  5. Resolve comments promptly

Document Structureâ€‹

  1. Use headings consistently
  2. Apply styles rather than manual formatting
  3. Keep paragraphs focused
  4. Use lists for clarity

Citation Managementâ€‹

  1. Add citations as you write
  2. Verify citation accuracy
  3. Keep library organized
  4. Choose style early

Version Controlâ€‹

  1. Create versions at logical points
  2. Add descriptive version notes
  3. Don't fear experimentation - you can restore
  4. Review history before final submission
